attributes.action: Ban the advertisement of high cost debt - 12 percent plus base rate
attributes.additional_details:
Through advertising, banks associate debt with happy outcomes. They use terms such as 'affordable finance', 'simple monthly payments' and suggest it is about 'control'.  

In reality, debt can lead to loss of control and cause financial instability. It can lead to poverty, homelessness and family breakdown. 

As a young man, I spent 12 years fighting banks in court to keep our family home - I don’t want others to experience that pain.

The Government should prevent the promotion of high interest debt.
attributes.background: We call for legislation which bans all advertising - physical, online, media - of high cost debt (incl. but not limited to loans, credit cards, store cards, buy now pay later schemes). Predatory financial companies see the cost of living crisis as an opportunity to sell unnecessary debt.
